title: Butterfly MCMC Line Painting Demo
text: vignette demonstrates complete workflow generating line paintings using mcmcPainter package, featuring beautiful butterfly.png image 100,000 MCMC iterations maximum detail quality.

title: Butterfly MCMC Line Painting Demo
text: First, letâ€™s analyze butterfly image understand characteristics:
code:
# Load package functions source("../R/mcmcPainter.R") source("../R/mcmc_core.R")  source("../R/utilities.R")  # Analyze the butterfly image image_path <- "../inst/extdata/butterfly.png" cat("Analyzing image:", basename(image_path), "
") ## Analyzing image: butterfly.png cat("=====================================
") ## ===================================== img_info <- get_image_info(image_path) cat("File:", basename(image_path), "
") ## File: butterfly.png cat("Original dimensions:", img_info$width, "x", img_info$height, "pixels
") ## Original dimensions: 2068 x 2091 pixels cat("File size:", round(img_info$file_size / 1024, 1), "KB
") ## File size: 4254.8 KB cat("PNG verification:", ifelse(img_info$is_true_png, "âœ“ True PNG", "âœ— Not a true PNG"), "
") ## PNG verification: âœ“ True PNG cat("Aspect ratio:", round(img_info$width / img_info$height, 3), "
") ## Aspect ratio: 0.989 cat("Total pixels:", format(img_info$width * img_info$height, big.mark = ","), "

") ## Total pixels: 4,324,188 # Display the original image library(magick) butterfly_img <- image_read(image_path) image_info <- image_info(butterfly_img) cat("Magick image info:
") ## Magick image info: cat("Dimensions:", image_info$width, "x", image_info$height, "
") ## Dimensions: 2068 x 2091 cat("Format:", image_info$format, "
") ## Format: PNG cat("Colorspace:", image_info$colorspace, "
") ## Colorspace: sRGB cat("Filesize:", round(image_info$filesize / 1024, 1), "KB

") ## Filesize: 4254.8 KB

title: Butterfly MCMC Line Painting Demo
text: Now letâ€™s configure MCMC parameters optimal performance butterfly image:
code:
# High-quality configuration for 100K steps cat("High-Quality MCMC Configuration:
") ## High-Quality MCMC Configuration: cat("================================
") ## ================================ cat("Target iterations: 100,000
") ## Target iterations: 100,000 cat("Save frequency: Every 5,000 iterations
") ## Save frequency: Every 5,000 iterations cat("Max dimension: 1200 (high resolution)
") ## Max dimension: 1200 (high resolution) cat("Expected runtime: 3-5 hours (depending on system)

") ## Expected runtime: 3-5 hours (depending on system) # Auto-configure MCMC parameters config <- auto_configure_mcmc(   image_path = image_path,   max_dimension = 1200,        # High resolution   target_iterations = 100000    # 100K iterations ) ## Image Analysis: ## ============== ## File: butterfly.png  ## Original dimensions: 2068 x 2091 pixels ## File size: 4254.8 KB ## PNG verification: âœ“ True PNG  ##  ## Optimized MCMC Parameters: ## ========================== ## Scaled dimensions: 1187 x 1200 pixels ## Scaling factor: 0.574  ## Adjusted iterations: 149185  ## Save frequency: 7459 cat("Optimized MCMC Parameters:
") ## Optimized MCMC Parameters: cat("==========================
") ## ========================== cat("Original dimensions:", config$original_width, "x", config$original_height, "
") ## Original dimensions: 2068 x 2091 cat("Scaled dimensions:", config$scaled_width, "x", config$scaled_height, "
") ## Scaled dimensions: 1187 x 1200 cat("Scaling factor:", round(config$scale_factor, 3), "
") ## Scaling factor: 0.574 cat("Adjusted iterations:", format(config$iterations, big.mark = ","), "
") ## Adjusted iterations: 149,185 cat("Save frequency:", format(config$save_every, big.mark = ","), "
") ## Save frequency: 7,459 cat("PNG verification:", ifelse(config$is_true_png, "âœ“ True PNG", "âœ— Not a true PNG"), "

") ## PNG verification: âœ“ True PNG # Calculate complexity metrics original_pixels <- config$original_width * config$original_height scaled_pixels <- config$scaled_width * config$scaled_height complexity_reduction <- (1 - scaled_pixels / original_pixels) * 100  cat("Complexity Analysis:
") ## Complexity Analysis: cat("===================
") ## =================== cat("Original pixels:", format(original_pixels, big.mark = ","), "
") ## Original pixels: 4,324,188 cat("Scaled pixels:", format(scaled_pixels, big.mark = ","), "
") ## Scaled pixels: 1,424,400 cat("Complexity reduction:", round(complexity_reduction, 1), "%

title: Butterfly MCMC Line Painting Demo
text: Now letâ€™s run MCMC algorithm generate line painting. take several hours 100K iterations:
code:
# Compile the C++ code for performance cat("Compiling C++ code...
") Rcpp::sourceCpp("../src/mcmc_painter_cpp.cpp") cat("C++ code compiled successfully!

")  res <- run_line_painter(   image_path = image_path,   max_dimension = 1200,        # High resolution   iters = 100000,              # 100K iterations   out_dir = "../inst/results/butterfly_100k_high_quality",   seed = 42,   auto_config = TRUE,          # Enable auto-configuration   verbose = TRUE )  cat("

title: Butterfly MCMC Line Painting Demo
text: MCMC completes, letâ€™s analyze results:
code:
# Load the final image with the same dimensions used in MCMC target_img <- load_image_rgb(image_path,                              out_w = res$canvas %>% dim() %>% .[2],                              out_h = res$canvas %>% dim() %>% .[1])  # Create default white canvas H <- dim(target_img)[1] W <- dim(target_img)[2] default_canvas <- array(1, dim = c(H, W, 3))  # Calculate performance metrics sse <- sum((target_img - res$best$canvas)^2) mse <- sse / length(target_img) psnr <- 20 * log10(1 / sqrt(mse))  cat("Performance Metrics:
") cat("==================
") cat("Best SSE:", round(sse, 2), "
") cat("Best MSE:", round(mse, 6), "
") cat("Best PSNR:", round(psnr, 2), "dB
") cat("Number of lines:", length(res$lines), "
") cat("Final dimensions:", W, "x", H, "

")  # Display optimization summary cat("Optimization Summary:
") cat("====================
") cat("Original dimensions:", config$original_width, "x", config$original_height, "
") cat("Final dimensions:", W, "x", H, "
") cat("Total iterations:", 100000, "
") cat("Save frequency:", 5000, "
") cat("PNG verification:", ifelse(config$is_true_png, "âœ“ True PNG", "âœ— Not a true PNG"), "
")

title: Butterfly MCMC Line Painting Demo
text: Create beautiful triptych showing progression white canvas final artwork:
code:
# Create triptych create_triptych(   default_canvas = default_canvas,   best_canvas = res$best$canvas,   target_img = target_img,   titles = c("Default (White Canvas)", "Best MCMC Result (100K steps)", "True Butterfly Image"),   main_title = "Butterfly Image: 100K MCMC Progression" )  # Save triptych in multiple formats cat("Saving triptych...
") output_dir <- "../inst/results/butterfly_100k_high_quality"  # Save as PDF pdf_path <- file.path(output_dir, "butterfly_100k_triptych.pdf") save_triptych(   default_canvas = default_canvas,   best_canvas = res$best$canvas,   target_img = target_img,   output_path = pdf_path,   width = 18, height = 7,  # Larger for high-quality output   titles = c("Default (White Canvas)", "Best MCMC Result (100K steps)", "True Butterfly Image"),   main_title = "Butterfly Image: 100K MCMC Progression",   format = "pdf" )  # Save as PNG png_path <- file.path(output_dir, "butterfly_100k_triptych.png") save_triptych(   default_canvas = default_canvas,   best_canvas = res$best$canvas,   target_img = target_img,   output_path = png_path,   width = 18, height = 7,  # Larger for high-quality output   titles = c("Default (White Canvas)", "Best MCMC Result (100K steps)", "True Butterfly Image"),   main_title = "Butterfly Image: 100K MCMC Progression",   format = "png" )  cat("Triptych saved successfully!
") cat("Files created:
") cat("- PDF:", pdf_path, "
") cat("- PNG:", png_path, "
")

title: Butterfly MCMC Line Painting Demo
text: Letâ€™s examine MCMC progresses 100K iterations:
code: # Load saved iterations for analysis library(png) library(grid)  # Function to load and display progression show_progression <- function(iterations = c(0, 25000, 50000, 75000, 100000)) {   par(mfrow = c(2, 3), mar = c(2, 2, 2, 1))      for (iter in iterations) {     if (iter == 0) {       # Show white canvas       img <- array(1, dim = c(H, W, 3))       title <- "Iteration 0 (White)"     } else {       # Load saved iteration       file_path <- file.path(output_dir, paste0("iter_", sprintf("%06d", iter), ".png"))       if (file.exists(file_path)) {         img <- readPNG(file_path)         title <- paste("Iteration", format(iter, big.mark = ","))       } else {         next       }     }          plot.new()     rasterImage(img, 0, 0, 1, 1)     title(title, cex.main = 0.8)   }      # Show target image   plot.new()   rasterImage(target_img, 0, 0, 1, 1)   title("Target Image", cex.main = 0.8)      par(mfrow = c(1, 1)) }  # Display progression (if files exist) if (dir.exists(output_dir)) {   show_progression() }

title: MCMC Line Painting Demo: Iamami Image
text: Letâ€™s create beautiful triptych showing progression default canvas final result:
code: # Function to create triptych create_triptych <- function(default_canvas, best_canvas, target_img,                             titles = c("Default (White Canvas)", "Best MCMC Result", "True Image")) {      # Set up the plotting area   par(mfrow = c(1, 3), mar = c(2, 2, 3, 2), oma = c(0, 0, 2, 0))      # Plot 1: Default white canvas   plot.new()   rasterImage(default_canvas, 0, 0, 1, 1)   title(main = titles[1], cex.main = 1.2, font.main = 2)      # Plot 2: Best MCMC result   plot.new()   rasterImage(best_canvas, 0, 0, 1, 1)   title(main = titles[2], cex.main = 1.2, font.main = 2)      # Plot 3: True target image   plot.new()   rasterImage(target_img, 0, 0, 1, 1)   title(main = titles[3], cex.main = 1.2, font.main = 2)      # Overall title   mtext("MCMC Line Painting: Iamami Image Progression",          outer = TRUE, line = 0, cex = 1.5, font = 2) }  # Create default white canvas H <- dim(target_img)[1] W <- dim(target_img)[2] default_canvas <- array(1, dim = c(H, W, 3))  # White background  # For demonstration, we'll use a simulated best result # In practice, this would be res$best$canvas from the MCMC run set.seed(42) simulated_best <- default_canvas + array(rnorm(H * W * 3, 0, 0.1), dim = c(H, W, 3)) simulated_best <- pmin(pmax(simulated_best, 0), 1)  # Create the triptych create_triptych(default_canvas, simulated_best, target_img)

Iteration Scaling Rationale:
")   cat("============================

")   cat("Adjusted iterations:", img_analysis$iterations, "

")      # Memory and time estimates   cat("
Resource Estimates:
")   cat("==================
")   estimated_memory_mb <- round(scaled_pixels * 3 * 8 / (1024 * 1024), 1)   estimated_time_min <- round(img_analysis$iterations / 1000, 1)      cat("Estimated memory usage:", estimated_memory_mb, "MB
")   cat("Estimated runtime:", estimated_time_min, "minutes
")   cat("Save frequency:", img_analysis$save_every, "iterations
") }  # Run performance analysis performance_analysis(img_analysis) ## Performance Optimization Analysis: ## ================================ ## Original image complexity: 476,740 pixels ## Scaled image complexity: 476,740 pixels ## Complexity reduction: 0 % ##  ## Iteration Scaling Rationale: ## ============================ ## Base iterations: 20000  ## Adjusted iterations: 20000  ## Scaling factor: 1 x ##  ## Resource Estimates: ## ================== ## Estimated memory usage: 10.9 MB ## Estimated runtime: 20 minutes ## Save frequency: 1000 iterations

code: # Function to create triptych create_triptych <- function(default_canvas, best_canvas, target_img,                             titles = c("Default (White Canvas)", "Best MCMC Result", "True Image")) {      # Set up the plotting area   par(mfrow = c(1, 3), mar = c(2, 2, 3, 2), oma = c(0, 0, 2, 0))      # Plot 1: Default white canvas   plot.new()   rasterImage(default_canvas, 0, 0, 1, 1)   title(main = titles[1], cex.main = 1.2, font.main = 2)      # Plot 2: Best MCMC result   plot.new()   rasterImage(best_canvas, 0, 0, 1, 1)   title(main = titles[2], cex.main = 1.2, font.main = 2)      # Plot 3: True target image   plot.new()   rasterImage(target_img, 0, 0, 1, 1)   title(main = titles[3], cex.main = 1.2, font.main = 2)      # Overall title   mtext("MCMC Line Painting: Leaf Image Progression",          outer = TRUE, line = 0, cex = 1.5, font = 2) }  # Create default white canvas H <- dim(target_img)[1] W <- dim(target_img)[2] default_canvas <- array(1, dim = c(H, W, 3))  # White background  # For demonstration, we'll use a simulated best result # In practice, this would be res$best$canvas from the MCMC run set.seed(42) simulated_best <- default_canvas + array(rnorm(H * W * 3, 0, 0.1), dim = c(H, W, 3)) simulated_best <- pmin(pmax(simulated_best, 0), 1)  # Clamp to [0,1]  # Create the triptych create_triptych(default_canvas, simulated_best, target_img)

text: Letâ€™s examine progression MCMC algorithm:
code:
# Function to analyze MCMC progression analyze_mcmc_progression <- function(out_dir) {   # Get list of iteration files   iter_files <- list.files(out_dir, pattern = "iter_.*\.png", full.names = TRUE)      if (length(iter_files) == 0) {     cat("No iteration files found. Run the MCMC first.
")     return(NULL)   }      # Extract iteration numbers   iter_nums <- as.numeric(gsub(".*iter_(\d+)\.png", "\1", basename(iter_files)))   iter_nums <- sort(iter_nums)      cat("MCMC progression analysis:
")   cat("Total iterations saved:", length(iter_nums), "
")   cat("Iteration range:", min(iter_nums), "to", max(iter_nums), "
")   cat("Save frequency:", ifelse(length(iter_nums) > 1,                                 iter_nums[2] - iter_nums[1], "N/A"), "

")      # Display first few and last few iterations   cat("First few iterations:", head(iter_nums, 3), "
")   cat("Last few iterations:", tail(iter_nums, 3), "
")      return(iter_nums) }  # Analyze the results (commented out since we haven't run MCMC yet) # analyze_mcmc_progression("inst/results/leaf_vignette_20k")

text: Letâ€™s create function calculate display performance metrics:
code:
# Function to calculate performance metrics calculate_performance_metrics <- function(target_img, canvas, lines) {   # Calculate SSE   sse <- sum((target_img - canvas)^2)      # Calculate PSNR (Peak Signal-to-Noise Ratio)   mse <- sse / length(target_img)   psnr <- 20 * log10(1 / sqrt(mse))      # Calculate structural similarity (simplified)   # In practice, you might use a proper SSIM implementation      cat("Performance Metrics:
")   cat("==================
")   cat("Sum of Squared Errors (SSE):", round(sse, 2), "
")   cat("Mean Squared Error (MSE):", round(mse, 6), "
")   cat("Peak Signal-to-Noise Ratio (PSNR):", round(psnr, 2), "dB
")   cat("Number of lines:", length(lines), "
")   cat("Canvas dimensions:", dim(canvas)[2], "x", dim(canvas)[1], "
")      return(list(sse = sse, mse = mse, psnr = psnr, n_lines = length(lines))) }  # Example usage (commented out since we haven't run MCMC yet) # metrics <- calculate_performance_metrics(target_img, res$canvas, res$lines)

# Function to create an interactive gallery create_interactive_gallery <- function(out_dir) {   iter_files <- list.files(out_dir, pattern = "iter_.*\.png", full.names = TRUE)      if (length(iter_files) == 0) {     cat("No iteration files found. Run the MCMC first.
")     return(NULL)   }      # Sort files by iteration number   iter_nums <- as.numeric(gsub(".*iter_(\d+)\.png", "\1", basename(iter_files)))   sorted_files <- iter_files[order(iter_nums)]      cat("Interactive Gallery Available:
")   cat("=============================
")   cat("Total images:", length(sorted_files), "
")   cat("Iteration range:", min(iter_nums), "to", max(iter_nums), "

")      cat("To view specific iterations:
")   cat("1. Open the output directory:", out_dir, "
")   cat("2. Navigate through iter_XXXXXX.png files
")   cat("3. Use view_rgb() function in R to display any image

")      # Show first few files   cat("First few files:
")   for (i in 1:min(3, length(sorted_files))) {     cat("  ", basename(sorted_files[i]), "
")   }      return(sorted_files) }  # Create gallery info (commented out since we haven't run MCMC yet) # gallery_files <- create_interactive_gallery("inst/results/leaf_vignette_20k")

# Function to demonstrate triptych creation demonstrate_triptych <- function(image_path, title = "MCMC Line Painting Demo") {   # Load image   target_img <- load_image_rgb(image_path, out_w = 400, out_h = 400)      # Create default canvas   H <- dim(target_img)[1]   W <- dim(target_img)[2]   default_canvas <- array(1, dim = c(H, W, 3))  # White background      # Create simulated best result for demonstration   set.seed(42)   simulated_best <- default_canvas + array(rnorm(H * W * 3, 0, 0.1), dim = c(H, W, 3))   simulated_best <- pmin(pmax(simulated_best, 0), 1)      # Create triptych   create_triptych(     default_canvas = default_canvas,     best_canvas = simulated_best,     target_img = target_img,     titles = c("Default Canvas", "Best Result", "Target Image"),     main_title = title   )      return(list(     default_canvas = default_canvas,     best_canvas = simulated_best,     target_img = target_img   )) }  # Demonstrate triptych for leaf image cat("Creating triptych for leaf image...
") ## Creating triptych for leaf image... leaf_triptych <- demonstrate_triptych(   "../inst/extdata/leaf_converted.png",    "Leaf Image MCMC Progression" ) # Demonstrate triptych for iamami image cat("
Creating triptych for iamami image...

# Performance analysis function analyze_performance <- function(configs, image_names) {   cat("Performance Analysis:
")   cat("====================

")      for (i in seq_along(configs)) {     config <- configs[[i]]     name <- image_names[i]          cat(name, "Image:
")     cat("--------
")          # Original vs scaled complexity     original_pixels <- config$original_width * config$original_height     scaled_pixels <- config$scaled_width * config$scaled_height          cat("Original complexity:", format(original_pixels, big.mark = ","), "pixels
")     cat("Scaled complexity:", format(scaled_pixels, big.mark = ","), "pixels
")     cat("Complexity reduction:", round((1 - scaled_pixels/original_pixels) * 100, 1), "%
")          # Performance estimates     estimated_memory_mb <- round(scaled_pixels * 3 * 8 / (1024 * 1024), 1)     estimated_time_min <- round(config$iterations / 1000, 1)          cat("Estimated memory:", estimated_memory_mb, "MB
")     cat("Estimated runtime:", estimated_time_min, "minutes
")     cat("Save frequency:", config$save_every, "iterations
")     cat("PNG verification:", ifelse(config$is_true_png, "âœ“ True PNG", "âœ— Not a true PNG"), "

")   } }  # Analyze performance for different configurations configs <- list(leaf_std, leaf_hq, leaf_quick, iamami_std) image_names <- c("Leaf (Standard)", "Leaf (High Quality)", "Leaf (Quick)", "Iamami (Standard)")  analyze_performance(configs, image_names) ## Performance Analysis: ## ==================== ##  ## Leaf (Standard) Image: ## -------- ## Original complexity: 1,137,600 pixels ## Scaled complexity: 360,000 pixels ## Complexity reduction: 68.4 % ## Estimated memory: 8.2 MB ## Estimated runtime: 20 minutes ## Save frequency: 1000 iterations ## PNG verification: âœ“ True PNG  ##  ## Leaf (High Quality) Image: ## -------- ## Original complexity: 1,137,600 pixels ## Scaled complexity: 810,000 pixels ## Complexity reduction: 28.8 % ## Estimated memory: 18.5 MB ## Estimated runtime: 33.8 minutes ## Save frequency: 1688 iterations ## PNG verification: âœ“ True PNG  ##  ## Leaf (Quick) Image: ## -------- ## Original complexity: 1,137,600 pixels ## Scaled complexity: 90,000 pixels ## Complexity reduction: 92.1 % ## Estimated memory: 2.1 MB ## Estimated runtime: 5 minutes ## Save frequency: 1000 iterations ## PNG verification: âœ“ True PNG  ##  ## Iamami (Standard) Image: ## -------- ## Original complexity: 476,740 pixels ## Scaled complexity: 476,740 pixels ## Complexity reduction: 0 % ## Estimated memory: 10.9 MB ## Estimated runtime: 20 minutes ## Save frequency: 1000 iterations ## PNG verification: âœ“ True PNG

text: Letâ€™s examine MCMC progresses 100K iterations:
code: # Load saved iterations for analysis library(png) library(grid)  # Function to load and display progression show_progression <- function(iterations = c(0, 25000, 50000, 75000, 100000)) {   par(mfrow = c(2, 3), mar = c(2, 2, 2, 1))      for (iter in iterations) {     if (iter == 0) {       # Show white canvas       img <- array(1, dim = c(H, W, 3))       title <- "Iteration 0 (White)"     } else {       # Load saved iteration       file_path <- file.path(output_dir, paste0("iter_", sprintf("%06d", iter), ".png"))       if (file.exists(file_path)) {         img <- readPNG(file_path)         title <- paste("Iteration", format(iter, big.mark = ","))       } else {         next       }     }          plot.new()     rasterImage(img, 0, 0, 1, 1)     title(title, cex.main = 0.8)   }      # Show target image   plot.new()   rasterImage(target_img, 0, 0, 1, 1)   title("Target Image", cex.main = 0.8)      par(mfrow = c(1, 1)) }  # Display progression (if files exist) if (dir.exists(output_dir)) {   show_progression() }

title: MCMC-Based Artistic Line and Dot Painting Generation
text: package implements Reversible Jump MCMC algorithm four types moves: Birth: Add new artistic elements (lines dots) based image residuals Death: Remove existing elements Jitter: Perturb element parameters (position, color, opacity, size) Swap: Reorder element rendering better composition

title: MCMC-Based Artistic Line and Dot Painting Generation
text: line-based artwork, line defined : - Position: Start end coordinates (x1, y1, x2, y2) - Color: RGB values (r, g, b) - Opacity: Alpha transparency (0-1) - Thickness: Line width pixels algorithm uses data-driven birth proposals, sampling new lines areas high image residuals focus important features.

title: MCMC-Based Artistic Line and Dot Painting Generation
text: pointillism-style artwork, dot defined : - Position: Center coordinates (x, y) - Color: RGB values (r, g, b) - Opacity: Alpha transparency (0-1) - Radius: Dot size pixels algorithm creates pointillism effects strategically placing dots varying sizes opacities.
